paper_abstract: Given a graph G and a spanning subgraph T of G, a backbone k-colouring for (G, T) is a mapping c : V (G) -> {1,...,k} such that vertical bar c(u) - c(v)vertical bar >= 2 for every edge uv is an element of E(T) and vertical bar c(u) - c(v)vertical bar >= 1 for every edge uv is an element of E(G) \ E(T). The backbone chromatic number BBC(G, T) is the smallest integer k such that there exists a backbone k-colouring of (G, T). In 2007, Broersma et al. [2] conjectured that BBC (G, T) <= 6 for every planar graph G and every spanning tree T of G. In this paper, we prove this conjecture when T has diameter at most four. (C) 2013 Elsevier B.V. paper_title: Backbone colouring: Tree backbones with small diameter in planar graphs
